required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Safety and Tolerability of Initial Periodontal Therapy Combined With Human Dental Pulp Stem Cell Injection in the Treatment of Chronic Periodontitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-blind, Blank Controlled, Dose-escalation Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Initial Periodontal Therapy Combined With Human Dental Pulp Stem Cell Injection in the Treatment of Chronic Periodontitis

brief_summary.textblock: The principal objective of this trial is to investigate the safety and tolerability of human dental pulp stem cells injection in the treatment of chronic periodontitis. The secondary objective is to provide the basis for dosage regimen for further clinical trials and to evaluate the preliminary efficacy.

detailed_description.textblock: Initial periodontal therapy involves cleaning, scaling and root planing. The present dose-escalating, randomized, double-blind, blank controlled clinical trial will be conducted to evaluate the safety and tolerability of dental pulp mesenchymal stem cells injection as an adjunct with Initial periodontal therapy in chronic periodontitis. Patients meeting the inclusion criteria will be assigned into five dose groups, in a 3:1 ratio within each group to treat with drug or placebo after initial periodontal therapy. The evaluation will be conducted based on safety and efficacy end points.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in respiration rate of Vital Signs.
primary_outcome.description: Respiration rate in mg(μl)/(h·g)

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in heart rate of Vital Signs.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in PT of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Prothrombin time (PT) is a screening test for exogenous coagulation factors.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in INR of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: International standardized ratio (INR) is calculated from prothrombin time and international sensitivity index (ISI) of the reagent.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in APTT of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Activated partial thromboplastin time (APTT) is a screening test for endogenous coagulation factors.

primary_outcome.description: Changes of total bilirubin concentration (μmol/L) in serum will be recorded.

primary_outcome.description: Changes of total bile acid concentration (μmol/L) in serum will be recorded.

primary_outcome.description: Changes of sodium concentration (mmol/L) in serum will be recorded.

primary_outcome.description: Changes of chlorine concentration (mmol/L) in serum will be recorded.

primary_outcome.description: C-reactive protein (CPR) is a phylogenetically highly conserved plasma protein, changes of its plasma concentration（mg/L）will be recorded.

primary_outcome.description: It refers to infectious diseases screening.

primary_outcome.description: Pregnancy test will be tested in female subjects

primary_outcome.description: Changes of urine specific gravity will be recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in urine pH of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Changes of urine pH value will be recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in urine glucose of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Changes of urine glucose will be examined by qualitative test (positive or negative).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in urine protein of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Changes of urine protein will be examined by qualitative test (positive or negative).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in urine ketone body of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Changes of urine ketone body will be examined by qualitative test (positive or negative).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in urine white blood cell of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Changes of white blood cell in urine will be examined by qualitative test (positive or negative).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in urine bilirubin of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Changes of urine bilirubin will be examined by qualitative test (positive or negative).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in urine occult blood of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Changes of urine occult blood will be examined by qualitative test (positive or negative).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in stool form of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Stool form is classified by Bristol Stool Form Scale into 7 categories scored from 1 to 7; (1) Separate hard lumps like nuts (difficult to pass); (2) Sausage-shaped but lumpy; (3) Like a sausage but with cracks on its surface; (4) Like a sausage or snake, smooth and soft; (5) Soft blobs with clear-cut edges (passed easily); (6) Fluffy pieces with ragged edges, a mushy stool; (7) Watery, no solid pieces, entirely liquid.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in stool white blood cells of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: White blood cell count in stools is reported in the form of number.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in stool red blood cells of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Red blood cell count in stools is reported in the form of number.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in stool parasite egg of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Parasite egg count in stools is reported in the form of number.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in stool OBT of Laboratory Examination
primary_outcome.description: Changes of stool OBT will be examined by qualitative test (positive or negative).

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in ECG
primary_outcome.description: The cardiac rhythm is showed in ECG in the form of continuous curve. Changes of this continuous curve will be recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events during the study period, and the severity of adverse events is determined according to the NCI CTCAE version 5.0.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 360 days and 720 days after administration
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events within 360 days and 720 days after administration, and the severity of adverse events is determined according to the NCI CTCAE version 5.0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Clinical Attachment Level (AL).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 90 days, 180 days ,360 days, 720 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Attachment Level (AL) may be assessed to the nearest millimeter by means of a graduated probe and expressed as the distance in millimeters from the CEJ to the bottom of the probeable gingival/periodontal pocket. The clinical assessment requires the measurement of the distance from the free gingival margin (FGM) to the CEJ for each tooth surface. After this recording, AL may be calculated from the periodontal chart (i.e. PPD - distance CEJ to FGM). In cases with gingival recession, the distance FGM-CEJ turns negative and, hence, will be added to the PPD to determine AL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Probing Depth (PD).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 90 days, 180 days ,360 days, 720 days.
secondary_outcome.description: The probing depth is the distance from the gingival margin to the bottom of the gingival sulcus/pocket, is measured to the nearest millimeter by means of periodontal probe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Probing Bleeding Index （BI）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 90 days, 180 days ,360 days, 720 days.
secondary_outcome.description: A periodontal probe is inserted to the "bottom" of the gingival/periodontal pocket applying light force and is moved gently along the tooth (root) surface. If bleeding is provoked by this examination, the site examined is considered bleeding on probing-positive and, hence, inflamed. Probing Bleeding Index is divided into 5 grades: 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Gingival recession （GR）
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 90 days, 180 days ,360 days, 720 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Exposure of the tooth through apical migration of the gingiva is called gingival recession. Recorded as the distance in millimeters from the CEJ to the gingival margin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Tooth Mobility (TM).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 90 days, 180 days ,360 days, 720 days.
secondary_outcome.description: The continuous loss of the supporting tissues during periodontal disease progression may result in increased tooth mobility, which is divided into 3 degree: I°, II°, and III°. Changes from baseline in tooth mobility will be recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in height of the periodontal bone defect and average density of alveolar ridge.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline, 90 days, 180 days ,360 days, 720 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in the height of the periodontal bone defect and the mean alveolar ridge density will be detected by Cone Beam Computed Tomography (CBCT)

arm_group.description: Human Dental Pulp Stem Cells Injection: 1×10^6 cells/periodontal defect site.
Human Dental Pulp Stem Cells Injection: 5×10^6 cells/periodontal defect site.
Human Dental Pulp Stem Cells Injection: 1×10^7 cells/periodontal defect site.
Human Dental Pulp Stem Cells Injection: 1×10^7 cells/periodontal defect site, two locations in total, and the total cell injection volume is 2 × 10^7 cells/2 periodontal defect sites.

Human Dental Pulp Stem Cells Injection: 1×10^7 cells/periodontal defect site, three or four locations in total, and the total cell injection volume is 3 × 10^7 to 4 × 10^7 cells/3 to 4 periodontal defect sites.

intervention.description: Investigational drugs: based on initial periodontal therapy (supragingival cleansing, subgingival scaling and root planning), human dental pulp stem cell injection will be given for a single local injection;
Blank control: initial Basal periodontal therapy (supragingival cleansing, subgingival scaling and root planning) followed by a single local injection of normal saline.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Stomatology, Peking University Third Hospital, Beijing, China.
